column4: Anyone have any idea why my gnome-cups-manager does not list any printers at all?
it hasn't found any printers.  How is your printer connected?
usb
does lsusb show it?
when you turn the printer on, does dmesg show it as a new device?
yes
lsusb shows the device
go through the add printer sequence.  Hopefully, when you get to the port setting, it will appear on the list of available ports.
gnome-cups-manager shows it as a detected device, but then installing drivers gives me no option of manufacturers
that sounds like the cups printer configuration file creation package needs to be install
what is that package?
in synaptic, do a search for cups, see what shows as not yet installed
I think cupsys-driver-gimpprint and cupsys-driver-gimpprint-data will do it.
but if they are already installed, then I'm wrong  :)
those are not installed...will do that, then get back to you
k
I installed cupsys-driver-gimpprint
however cupsys-driver-gimpprint-data was not found
I show it in my synaptic.  possibly you don't have all repositories enabled?
I have universe and multivers
a search on packages.ubuntu.com also does not find cupsys-driver-gimpprint-data
